name: COUNCIL ON AMERICAN-ISLAMIC RELATIONS CALIFORNIA
mission: CAIR works to protect and defend the constitutional rights of American Muslims, thereby supporting the rights of all Americans.
theoryOfChange: By combining legal action, policy advocacy, and community empowerment, CAIR-CA seeks to dismantle systemic Islamophobia and protect the constitutional rights of Muslims.

evaluationSources: Yuri Kochiyama Impact Award (Asian Law Caucus)
M. Shanara Gilbert Human Rights Award (Society of American Law Teachers)
ChangeMaker Award (South Asian Americans Leading Together)
Fred Korematsu Civil Rights award (American Muslim Voice Foundation)
Unsung Hero Award (National Lawyers Guild-SF Chapter)

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ca.cair.com/zakat (Source: https://ca.cair.com/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: ibn_sabil (+5)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: ADVOCACY (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 34/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.

score_details.score_summary: COUNCIL ON AMERICAN-ISLAMIC RELATIONS CALIFORNIA shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ca.cair.com/zakat (Source: https://ca.cair.com/zakat)

all_citations.claim: CAIR California focuses on civil rights and maintains a high program expense ratio.
The organization reported total revenue of $17,442,755 and holds 14.5 months of working capital.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for fund distribution.
The organization provides multiple giving methods for donors to support its advocacy work.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall score due to its high financial efficiency and critical role in civil rights advocacy. Its Zakat-eligible status and low fundraising costs make it a highly attractive option for Muslim donors.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing public transparency regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics to further validate impact directness.
Expanding third-party impact evaluations to complement existing financial reporting.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for donors seeking to support urgent social justice causes, particularly within the American Muslim community [3]. As a Zakat-eligible entity, it adheres to specific policies to ensure funds are distributed according to traditional asnaf categories, reinforcing its track record as a trusted community institution [3][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: CAIR California demonstrates high organizational capacity, allocating an 83.7% program expense ratio toward its core missions of civil rights and policy advocacy [1][2]. While the direct cost per beneficiary is not publicly specified, the organization maintains a healthy 14.5 months of working capital, ensuring long-term stability for its legal and media programs [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California defends the constitutional rights of American Muslims through robust legal advocacy and civil rights protection.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 83.7% ensures the vast majority of funds directly support civil rights and advocacy work.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.07 per $1 raised.
Strong liquidity position with 14.5 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: CAIR California operates as a leading grassroots civil rights and advocacy organization dedicated to protecting the liberties of the American Muslim community [1]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $17,442,755 to support its statewide programs in policy, media relations, and legal services [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall score due to its high financial efficiency and critical role in civil rights advocacy. Its Zakat-eligible status and low fundraising costs make it a highly attractive option for Muslim donors.

areas_for_improvement.context: While the organization tracks <cite id="13">5 outcome metrics</cite>, it currently lacks public <cite id="14">cost-per-beneficiary data</cite> which would further validate its delivery efficiency.
To reach the highest tier of impact evidence, the organization could benefit from <cite id="15">external evaluations or tracking outcomes</cite> over a longer multi-year horizon.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization maintains high governance standards with a <cite id="11">93% independent board</cite> and <cite id="8">Platinum transparency</cite>.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is actively tracking 5 outcome metrics and maintains a Platinum transparency rating to mitigate data gaps.
risk_factors: <cite id="15">No third-party impact evaluation</cite> currently available
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="14">lack of specific beneficiary data</cite> to calculate cost-effectiveness metrics.

confidence.notes: Strong financial data and transparency signals; impact evidence is internally tracked but not externally verified.

alignment.explanation: CAIR-CA is a strong fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="17">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and serving the <cite id="18">ibn sabil (wayfarer/immigrant)</cite> asnaf category through its legal and immigration services.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust CAIR-CA due to its <cite id="8">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a <cite id="11">93% independent board</cite> that provides rigorous oversight. The organization also maintains <cite id="12">documented strategic goals</cite> for its civil rights and media advocacy work.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the organization could publish more granular <cite id="14">beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for independent assessment of its reach.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient, with a <cite id="5">83.7% program expense ratio</cite> that significantly outperforms the <cite id="16">peer median of 77.5%</cite>. The organization currently <cite id="13">tracks 5 outcome metrics</cite> to monitor its progress.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="15">seeking external evaluation</cite> to complement its internal outcome tracking.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Internal outcome tracking with 5 metrics
donor_fit_matrix.giving_style: Direct legal service and systemic advocacy

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service delivery rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California defends the constitutional rights of American Muslims through robust legal advocacy and civil rights protection.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize civil rights protection and legal advocacy for American Muslims and value high programmatic spending efficiency.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through legal and immigration services
Care about systemic advocacy and media representation of Muslims
Value organizations with strong financial growth and transparency seals
Prefer supporting established grassroots infrastructure in California
giving_considerations: High program ratio means almost all funds reach the mission
Advocacy impact is often long-term and harder to quantify than direct aid
Strong liquidity suggests the organization is well-prepared for legal emergencies
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking immediate, tangible relief metrics (like meals served) or those requiring RCT-level evidence of impact.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that outcomes are <cite id="13">internally measured across 5 metrics</cite>, but lacks external third-party validation.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: CAIR-CA aims to protect civil liberties and promote an accurate image of Muslims through <cite id="12">legal services, media partnerships, and engagement with public officials</cite>.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that advocacy efforts are effectively changing public policy and protecting individual rights.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The rapid <cite id="4">49.7% revenue growth</cite> suggests high community demand for expanded legal and advocacy services.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="5">83.7% program ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="16">peer median of 77.5%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on advocacy and legal services with comparable scale
similar_organizations.name: IMRC

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on legal advocacy and justice reform
similar_organizations.name: Innocence Project

similar_organizations.differentiator: Regional advocacy focus with similar legal service components
similar_organizations.name: Project South

strengths.detail: The organization directs an impressive <cite id="5">83.7% of its total expenses</cite> toward its core missions of civil rights and legal services.
CAIR-CA demonstrates elite fiscal management, requiring only <cite id="6">$0.07 in fundraising costs</cite> to generate each dollar of revenue.
The charity maintains <cite id="9">14.5 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring long-term stability for its advocacy and legal operations.

strengths_deep_dive: CAIR-CA's financial health is characterized by rapid growth and disciplined spending. The organization's <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 49.7%</cite> indicates a successful scaling of its donor base and community support. This growth is managed by a <cite id="10">board of 15 members</cite>, with <cite id="11">93% independent board members</cite>, ensuring strong oversight. Furthermore, the organization has <cite id="12">documented its theory of change</cite>, focusing on enhancing the understanding of Islam and protecting civil liberties through a multi-faceted approach involving law enforcement, public officials, and media partners.
rich_narrative.summary: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California (CAIR-CA) serves as a vital legal and advocacy pillar for the American Muslim community, focusing on <cite id="1">protecting and defending constitutional rights</cite>. As a statewide grassroots organization, it operates across major regions including <cite id="2">Los Angeles, San Diego, and Orange County</cite> to provide direct legal services and civil rights protection. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization demonstrated significant growth, reporting <cite id="3">total revenue of $17,442,755</cite>, which represents a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 49.7%</cite>. This financial expansion supports a robust programmatic infrastructure where <cite id="5">83.7% of expenses are dedicated to program services</cite>, far exceeding industry benchmarks for advocacy organizations. CAIR-CA maintains a high level of operational efficiency, spending only <cite id="6">$0.07 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions. Beyond legal defense, the organization engages in <cite id="7">community education and media relations</cite> to promote an accurate image of Muslims and challenge systemic discrimination. Its commitment to transparency is evidenced by its <cite id="8">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of recognition for non-profit data disclosure.
